stream_context.summary: Kaze continues building the saloon section of the cowboy world, focusing on a secret cave accessed through a hidden door. He finalises general layout, textures and rail geometry and brainstorms a Shy-Guy minecart chase set-piece that will award a star.

development_findings.summary: Most of the saloon overworld mesh is imported; background skybox and vertex-coloured carpet need re-doing because layer names changed during a merge.
development_findings.quote: I still gotta re-vertex color the carpet. It probably went away because the layers were named differently and I merged them.

development_findings.summary: A generic net-physics function is now written, allowing any hanging or wobbling objects (e.g., cargo nets) to be added quickly.
development_findings.quote: I wrote a generic function for this now, so this is super easy to add to anything.

development_findings.summary: New dialogue-cutscene system is implemented and functioning.
development_findings.quote: One cool thing I didn't showcase yet – we have new dialogue cutscenes.

development_findings.summary: Room-system algorithm was optimised to skip actor processing more efficiently, removing a bit of lag.
development_findings.quote: I actually improved that algorithm recently. It's a lot better now.

development_findings.summary: Secret saloon door leads to a cave where Shy Guys illegally drink chocolate milk; entering triggers a minecart chase star.
development_findings.quote: We're gonna go through it, cut into a room where a bunch of cowboys are hanging out and they're secretly drinking choccy milk, which is illegal in this world.

development_findings.summary: Design settled on three parallel rails with two or three minecarts each; player jumps between carts while Snuffits fire large projectiles. Falling or landing on the track will fade Mario out (fail state).
development_findings.quote: I think we should try the three-minecart idea and make this work on Mario platforming.

development_findings.summary: End of the chase will likely drop all participants onto a lower platform for either a quick fight or immediate star reward; still undecided.
Minecart guidance will reuse SM64’s dynamic wall trick or splines so carts stick to curves without derailing.
development_findings.quote: There's a dynamic object that is only solid while you are in the minecart – the minecart drives along that around the curves.

development_findings.summary: GlideN64 shows combiner artefacts on rail textures; confirmed emulator bug, not level geometry.
development_findings.quote: I think it is rendering fine. It's just a GlideN bug.

development_findings.summary: Memory budget is 8 MB; extra 4 MB enables segmentation and ~3–5 % speedup. Kaze compiles under WSL2.
development_findings.quote: This one uses 4 extra megabytes... It gives a bit of a speed-up – maybe 3-5 %.

development_findings.summary: Game will be free & open-source; possible monetisation via boxed OST cartridge plus manual.
development_findings.quote: You can’t buy the game, but you can buy a souvenir about the game.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s OBS crashed at stream start; continues despite technical hiccup.
Girlfriend’s mother was recently hospitalised – briefly dampens mood.
context_findings.quote: Since last stream, my girlfriend's mom had to go to the hospital. It turns out... that's fucking depressing.

context_findings.summary: Lives in Canada (~3 years) and embraces minimalist lifestyle; disdains expensive status items.
context_findings.quote: I don't value having expensive stuff at all... When I see people buying expensive things I think of Elliot Rodger.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on distribution: dislikes selling digital copies because duplication is free; prefers merch.
context_findings.quote: Video games should not be monetised off of video game sales... You should sell souvenirs of your video games.

context_findings.summary: Sees himself as role-model to audience; feels responsibility to ‘live in a good way.’
context_findings.quote: When you are an online creator like SimpleFlips or me you kind of are also gonna be a role model... there is additional responsibility.

context_findings.summary: Worries about Nintendo takedowns; ~70 of his videos were removed for popularity.
context_findings.quote: Usually when a video gets too popular they just take it down.

biobak.summary: Provided Shy Guy models; Kaze tweaked combiners to stop unwanted environment colour flicker.
biobak.quote: Did I change anything from what you've sent? I changed the Shy Guys a little bit because they had an effect on it.

biobak.summary: Supplies texture and dialogue ideas (e.g., bounty/murky way pun) and will create milk-saloon signage.

zeina.summary: Offered to model milk bottles but ‘forgot’; asset still missing.
zeina.quote: We still need a bunch of milk bottles and stuff and Zeina said she wanted to give those to us, but I guess she forgot.

key_stories.title: Losing the Carpet Shading
key_stories.summary: After merging layers, the saloon’s carpet lost its vertex shading. Kaze notices during a walkthrough and decides it must be repainted.
key_stories.challenge: Accidental deletion of vertex colours during layer merge.
key_stories.process: Investigated layer naming, confirmed shading was removed; planned quick repaint.
key_stories.outcome: Task added to to-do list; no functional impact but visual downgrade until fixed.
key_stories.key_quote: Where did the vertex shading on the carpet go?... I can copy that back or just redo it.

key_stories.title: Designing the Minecart Chase
key_stories.summary: Kaze and chat iterate on how to turn a brief secret cave into a memorable star. They debate controls, rails, camera, failure conditions and enemy behaviour before settling on multi-cart jumping with Snuffit gunmen.
key_stories.challenge: Create engaging, fair gameplay inside narrow cave without letting players trivialise chase.
key_stories.process: Discussed full minecart control vs platforming, number of carts, rail collision, cinematic collapse; analysed SM64 minecart code for dynamic walls.
key_stories.outcome: Prototype plan: three rails, two minecarts each, player jumps, falling equals fail; star at end; implementation scheduled.
key_stories.key_quote: I think we should try the three-minecart idea and make this work on Mario platforming.

key_stories.title: Open-Source, Not For Sale
key_stories.summary: Kaze reaffirms the hack will be released free with full source, considering only an OST cartridge as paid merch.
key_stories.challenge: Reconciling desire for free distribution with need to monetise work.
key_stories.process: Explained stance on digital duplication, compared to souvenirs, brainstormed boxed soundtrack idea.
key_stories.outcome: Tentative plan to sell physical OST + manual; game itself remains free.
key_stories.key_quote: You can’t buy the game, but you can buy a souvenir about the game.

open_questions.context: Kaze toggles between partial first-person (hold-L) and contemplating always-first-person for consistency with Yoshi hook.
questions: Have you decided whether the game will switch to full first-person when holding L?
What playtesting data will guide that decision?

open_questions.context: Design agreed in concept but details (enemy count, end-of-track event, controls, collision tricks) remain unsettled.
questions: Will Mario be locked to cart speed or retain full physics?
How will you telegraph projectile timing to players?
Is there a fallback if jumping between carts proves too hard?

open_questions.context: Zeina was to model bottles for saloon; asset not delivered.
questions: What is the status of the milk bottle models?
Do you have a contingency if Zeina is busy?

open_questions.context: Star count rising beyond 165; Kaze mentions 175+ and delayed expectations.
questions: What is the current internal milestone schedule?
How will you keep scope manageable to hit release?

open_questions.context: Kaze suffered 70+ video takedowns by Nintendo; game will be free & open-source.
questions: What precautions are in place to minimize potential Nintendo legal action?
Will distribution be decentralized or mirrored?
